entry.title: Re: In SAP Learning Hub, is BDC, SAC, Datasphere, S/4HANA...
entry.content:
Hi Mel - I in the Learning Hub practice sessions, I see SAC, S/4HANA Private, BW/4HANA

I do not see any Datasphere or SAP Databricks; I recommend going to https://learninghub.sap.com/help-center and clicking the ? and selecting one of the "contact us" options.

entry.title: Be the U in SAP 4 U - SAP for Utilities in September
entry.content:
I am looking forward to SAP for Utilities, produced by ASUG, in September in Denver, Colorado.

Source: ASUG

Top reasons to attend:

  1. Community meetups:

Last year we held meetups for Water utilities, Canadian utilities, electric ‚Äì here‚Äôs a look back at what as discussed for Water utilities:

 

We will discuss what you want to discuss.  Take this opportunity to share and learn best practices from your peers.

 

  1. Hear from other utilities, just like yours. 

Discover how leading utilities are embracing cutting-edge technologies to transform and streamline their operations. Learn how SAP innovations are driving business simplification

 

  1. Visit  showcase of SAP solutions tailored for utilities.

Head to the exhibition hall to experience live demos, engage in expert-led discussions, and connect with exhibitors offering cutting-edge technologies, support services, software innovations and hosting options.

 

 

Gather Insights from Customer Stories:

 

  • Hear from Consumers Energy explore their SAP S/4HANA launch playbook‚Äîcovering everything from internal buy-in and scope alignment to financial and regulatory approvals, team mobilization, and organizational change‚Äîbased on their journey since May 2024.
  • Join Dominion Energy to explore their SAP S/4HANA EAM journey, highlighting how innovation, metrics, and a growth mindset have fostered organizational change, employee empowerment, and increased solution adoption.
  • Learn from Eversource to hear their CIS transformation enhanced address validation‚Äîimproving billing accuracy, reducing fraud and safety risks, and ensuring regulatory compliance and efficient service delivery.
  • Join the OGE (Oklahoma Gas and Electric) session ‚ÄúThrough the Breach ‚Äì Security and Compliance in the Shared Responsibility Model‚Äù to explore how RISE with SAP delivers transformative technological and procedural advancements that strengthen organizational security and compliance.
  • Attend PG&E (Pacific Gas & Electric) to explore their Clean Core transformation with RISE with SAP‚Äîhighlighting their shift from a complex legacy ERP to a modern, agile system through fit-to-standard principles, stakeholder alignment, and enterprise design that supports decarbonization, regulatory compliance, and customer-focused innovation.
  • Southern California Edison presents its Next Gen ERP, showcasing how SAP S/4HANA is fueling innovation, advancing sustainability goals, and driving operational excellence‚Äîraising business unit maturity to the top quartile of the industry.
  • Southwest Gas features real-world insights as utilities and partners‚Äîbuilding on their SAP CX 1.0 successes‚Äîcollaborate to shape SAP CX 2.0 with forward-looking architecture, increased extensibility, and modern development strategies.
  • DTE Energy shares how integrating SAP CDP with SAP Emarsys is transforming customer engagement by unifying fragmented data, automating processes, and eliminating silos to enhance operational efficiency.
  • PG&E and SAP address the growing complexity of New Load Connections and Electric Generation Interconnections, spotlighting how utilities are streamlining these critical processes amid California‚Äôs rapid energy transition and rising customer electrification. (note: first time I recall an important topic like this is discussed at a conference).
  • OG&E (along with fellow SAP Mentor Diego Dora) showcases how generative AI-powered tools helped overcome delivery challenges in their SAP S/4HANA transformation‚Äîautomating and governing critical lifecycle processes to accelerate results without compromising quality.
  • Eugene Water & Electric Board showcases how their cloud-based SAP S/4HANA implementation is unlocking the Clean Core strategy‚Äîenhancing resiliency, automating operations, and optimizing processes across finance, customer service, and meter-to-cash.
  • Discover how Loudoun Water‚Äôs Jeff Smith leveraged his experience at Fairfax Water to implement reporting enhancements that increase visibility and improve EAM Master Data
  • UGI Utilities shares how a decade of technology modernization revealed integration challenges that ultimately led to a strategic shift toward a unified financial platform using SAP solutions.
  • Chesapeake Utilities Corporation highlights its transformation of Customer and Field Services by modernizing its Customer Information platform, integrating Florida City Gas, and leveraging RISE with SAP and SAP BTP Enterprise Asset Management to enhance customer experiences and application hosting.
  • Discover how SAP C4C V2 enhancements are tailored for SoCalGas‚Äîintegrating industry-specific use cases to elevate end-user experience, operational efficiency, and customer engagement.
  • London Hydro shares its end-to-end Greenfield CIS transformation with SAP S/4HANA‚Äîfocused on modernizing billing through dual contract conversion, streamlining customer communications, and advancing its vision as a digital-first utility in partnership with TCS.
  • Southwest Gas showcases its digital transformation in field operations using SAP BTP, SuccessFactors, and Concur to optimize operational efficiency through automated expense reporting and streamlined training management with QR code-enabled access.

Not a customer session but an important session from SAP:

  • Explore SAP's future-ready service management, where the planned sunset of legacy CS features by 2030 prompts utilities to understand evolving capabilities, retained functions, and new innovations within SAP S/4HANA.

 

Register today: https://events.asug.com/event/SAP-For-Utilities-2025/agenda

Hope to see you in Denver in September.  Do you have any must-see sessions?

entry.title: Re: Need advice and pointers to update on my classic ABAP skill
entry.content: I know ADT is big, CDS views, but also ABAP Cloud and "clean core".  You can check the free Learning Journeys here: https://learning.sap.com/courses/introduction-to-abap-in-the-cloud

I really enjoy this newsletter‚Äîit always has useful updates and fresh content. It‚Äôs a great way to stay in the "know" with what‚Äôs happening in the SAP Utilities community.

Thank you

entry.title: Re: Is there a S/4HANA cloud test/demo/development system...
entry.content:
I recommend trying the SAP Cloud Appliance Library https://cal.sap.com/catalog#/solutions 

I'm not sure the transactions you listed would be in S/4HANA Cloud.

A fully activated appliance should work.

entry.title: Re: Request for ISO27001 Certificate
entry.content:
Logon to this site and it is there: https://www.sap.com/about/trust-center/certification-compliance/compliance-finder.html?sort=latest_desc&search=bydesign

It is also available in SAP for Me

entry.title: Re: Lumira Bookmark "Error during script processing"
entry.content: I am so sorry - I haven't used the product in a while. Thank you for mentioning me.

entry.title: Meet SAP TechEd Community Speaker Marla Alschweiki
entry.content:
If you are traveling to Berlin, I hope you will make time to join Marla's community session.

CT1245 | Hugging Face Transformers in AI Foundation

Community Talk

Learn how to deploy Hugging Face Transformers in SAP AI Core, manage them via SAP AI Launchpad, and connect them to SAP apps like SAP Fiori or SAP Cloud Application Programming Model (CAP). This session shares architecture, tips, and real-world use cases for bringing custom NLP models into AI Foundation on SAP Business Technology Platform.

SAP TechEd Berlin - Session Catalog

Get to know Marla:
Marla is a Senior Data and AI Development Consultant with a strong curiosity and a passion for learning. Her current areas of expertise and interest are in SAP AI, machine learning, and data analytics.  She specializes in integrating AI capabilities into SAP systems, creating innovative and practical solutions for real-world enterprises needs.

Hobbies & Interests:
Outside of work, Marla likes to stay active and do some sport, learning languages (currently French), and spend time with her little puppy Carlo. 

Marla and Carlo

Why Attend Marla's Session:
At SAP TechEd, Marla will be presenting a session on leveraging Hugging Face Transformers in the SAP AI Foundation. She‚Äôll explore how to bring cutting-edge NLP models into SAP BTP, deploy them seamlessly in SAP AI Core, manage them efficiently with AI Launchpad, and connect them to SAP apps like Fiori or CAP , Along the way, you might even pick up a few insider tips for confidently navigating Hugging Face like a pro.

I hope you make time for Marla's session.

entry.title: Re: SAP Community Hobbies Series: Mind Your Step (Walking and Hiking)
entry.content:
Impressive!  I walk a lot myself and hiked pre-covid but haven't taken the time to drive to a location to hike.  You are an inspiration.  Maybe I will start hiking again.

Vinnie wrote this about my passion for crocheting: https://florence20.typepad.com/renaissance/2020/03/technology-and-my-passion-tammy-powlas-and-crochet.html - in fact, I was flying to Denver this week and completed crocheting 1 scarf while on the flight.

entry.title: SAP4U SAP for Utilities in Denver - it's a wrap
entry.content:
View of Broncos Stadium from the Hotel

Denver was a great place for the conference.  You could see Broncos stadium from the hotel.

Day 0

Day 0 started with a BTP "pre-con".

The room was full, and we received overviews of BTP Integration, Analytics, Business Data Cloud, AI and more.

Source: SAP

Next, we had a water meet-up, where attendees could choose the topics to discuss:

One attendee said the discussion was worth the price of the conference.

Keynote

Keynote covered AI of course, and we saw a great deal of that during the pre-con.

Source: SAP

SAP's Viktor Kehayov covered Field Service Management:

SAP Service Cloud Session

Source: SAP

SAP's Tina Kuo covered the road map and new features.

Source: SAP

What customer service rep wouldn't want this feature?

Next, I attended session with SAP's Dominic Brennan and Robert Straubinger about SAP Advanced Service Execution:

Source: SAP

The CS module is sunsetting in 2030 and utilities will need to move to this.

Dom and Robert also showed a new services product they are working on with a California utility:

Source: SAP

Road map:

Source: SAP

The all important take aways from the session:

Source: SAP

All SAP Utilities customers should be familiar with this slide.

EAM

I attended a session with Dominion Energy and EY about change management.

Outside the lines

I liked the John Denver exhibit in the Colorado Convention Center:

Such great music.

On a related "note", there is an EAM conference next March in Houston:

https://asset.tac-insights.com/ 

Next year, SAP Utilities will be in San Antonio: https://www.asug.com/events/sap-for-utilities-2026

Special thanks to Alyssa Perna Marc Rosson for a great conference.

entry.title: Re: SM37 Page Limits - Pulling data from SM37 spool with over 100,000 Pages
entry.content:
For large files, what about writing them to the server and downloading them with CG3Y transaction?  See this link https://community.sap.com/t5/application-development-and-automation-discussions/using-transactions-cg3z-and-cg3y/td-p/592090

 

SM37 seems like a lot of work.

entry.title: Re: Fiori 2.0 in HANA 1909
entry.content:
You can still access the SAP Gui in S/4HANA 1909.  

Note S/4HANA 1909 extended maintenance ends December 31, 2025
